opendial.bn.distribs

Interface IndependentProbDistribution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProbDistribution
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalTable, ContinuousDistribution

    public interface IndependentProbDistribution
extends ProbDistribution
    Representation of an unconditional probability distribution P(X), where X is a random variable.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-20 21:16:08 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Method Detail

      • getProb

        double getProb(Value value)
        Returns the probability P(value), if any is specified. Else, returns 0.0f.
        Parameters:
        value - the value for the random variable
        Returns:
        the associated probability, if one exists.

      • sample

        Value sample()
      throws DialException
        Returns a sampled value for the distribution.
        Returns:
        the sampled value
        Throws:
        DialException - if no sample could be extracted.

      • getValues

        java.util.Set<Value> getValues()
        Returns a set of possible values for the distribution. If the distribution is continuous, assumes a discretised representation of the distribution.
        Returns:
        the possible values for the distribution

      • toContinuous

        ContinuousDistribution toContinuous()
                             throws DialException
        Returns a continuous representation of the distribution.
        Returns:
        the distribution in a continuous form
        Throws:
        DialException - if the distribution could not be converted to a continuous form

      • getValues

        default java.util.Set<Value> getValues(ValueRange range)
                                throws DialException
        Returns the set of possible values for the distribution. If the distribution is continuous, the method returns a discretised set. The value range is ignored.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        range - ignored
        Returns:
        a set of possible values for the variable
        Throws:
        DialException - if the possible values could not be extracted.

      • getProb

        default double getProb(Assignment condition,
                       Value head)
                throws DialException
        Returns the probability for the head assignment, if the value can be found in the distribution. Else, returns 0.0. The conditional assignment is ignored.
        Specified by:
        getProb in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment
        head - the value for the head variable
        Returns:
        the resulting probability
        Throws:
        DialException - if the probability could not be extracted.

      • sample

        default Value sample(Assignment condition)
              throws DialException
        Returns a sample from the distribution (the condition is ignored).
        Specified by:
        sample in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        condition - the conditional assignment for Y1,...,Ym
        Returns:
        the sampled values for the random variable
        Throws:
        DialException - if no value(s) could be sampled
